{{Other people|Allan MacKenzie}} {{Infobox comics character |image=Al MacKenzie.png |caption= |real_name=Alphonso MacKenzie |species= |publisher=[[Marvel Comics]] |debut=''[[Nick Fury vs. S.H.I.E.L.D.]]'' #3 (Aug. 1988) |creators=[[Bob Harras]] (writer)
[[Paul Neary]] (artist) |alliances=[[S.H.I.E.L.D.]]
[[Central Intelligence Agency|C.I.A.]] |aliases= |powers= }} '''Al MacKenzie''' is a [[fictional character]] appearing in [[American comic book]]s published by [[Marvel Comics]]. Alphonso "Mack" Mackenzie appeared in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] TV series ''[[Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.]]'', portrayed by [[Henry Simmons]]. He eventually became the new director of S.H.I.E.L.D. ==Publication history== Al MacKenzie first appeared in ''[[Nick Fury vs. S.H.I.E.L.D.]]'' #3 (Aug. 1988), and was created by [[Bob Harras]] and [[Paul Neary]]. The character subsequently appears in ''[[Nick Fury, Agent of S.H.I.E.L.D. (comic book)|Nick Fury, Agent of S.H.I.E.L.D.]]'' #1-7 (Sept. 1989-Jan. 1990). An entry for Al MacKenzie appears in issue four of the reference series ''[[Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe|The Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe Update '89]]''. ==Fictional character biography== Al MacKenzie was born in [[Austin, Texas]]. He was once the [[Central Intelligence Agency|C.I.A.]] liaison to [[S.H.I.E.L.D.]]''The Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe'' vol. 3 #4. Marvel Comics (New York). He became romantically involved with Contessa [[Valentina Allegra di Fontaine]] after a while, which led to an estrangement between him and [[Nick Fury]].''Nick Fury, Agent of S.H.I.E.L.D.'' vol. 3 #1. Marvel Comics (New York). Because of this, he returned to the CIA with the Contessa.''Nick Fury, Agent of S.H.I.E.L.D.'' vol. 3 #3. Marvel Comics (New York). MacKenzie later joined the S.H.I.E.L.D. organization full-time, and spent considerable time as the senior liaison officer to the C.I.A.''Nick Fury, Agent of S.H.I.E.L.D.'' vol. 3 #6. Marvel Comics (New York). Subsequently, under unknown circumstances, MacKenzie resigned from S.H.I.E.L.D., and wrote a "tell-all" book entitled ''UnSHIELDed: an Unauthorized Insider's Look Behind the World's Most Powerful Global Spy Network'', which purportedly explained some of the history behind the organization from his point of view.''[[Amazing Fantasy]]'' vol. 2 # 10. Marvel Comics (New York). Since then, he also acted as an unofficial source to [[Ben Urich]], prodding Urich and [[Jessica Jones]] to attempt to expose Fury's unauthorized mission to [[Latveria]].''[[The Pulse (comics)|The Pulse]]'' # 9. Marvel Comics (New York). ==In other media== [[File:Henry Simmons as Alphonso "Mack" Mackenzie.png|thumb|upright|right|[[Henry Simmons]] as Al Mackenzie in ''[[Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.]]'']] Mackenzie appears in the TV series ''[[Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.]]'', portrayed by [[Henry Simmons]]. His full name is [[Mack (Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.)|Alphonso Mackenzie]], but goes by the nickname "Mack". He is an African-American [[mechanic]] and [[engineer]] who is recruited into the newly rebuilt S.H.I.E.L.D. by [[Phil Coulson]] after the events of the film ''[[Captain America: The Winter Soldier]]''. He is old friends with [[Mockingbird (Marvel Comics)|Barbara "Bobbi" Morse]].{{cite episode|title=[[One of Us (Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.)|One of Us]]|series=Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.|credits=Tancharoen, Kevin (director); Monica Owusu-Breen (writer)|network=[[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]]|airdate=March 17, 2015|season=2|number=13}} He develops a close friendship with [[Leo Fitz]],{{cite web|url=https://comics2film.com/marvel-s-agents-of-s-h-i-e-l-d-fitz-mack-s-bromance|title=Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. {{!}} Fitz + Mack's Bromance|publisher=Comics2Film|date=July 31, 2019|access-date=August 12, 2019|archive-date=August 12, 2019|archive-url=https://archive.today/20190812155653/https://comics2film.com/marvel-s-agents-of-s-h-i-e-l-d-fitz-mack-s-bromance|url-status=live}} and a romantic relationship with [[Yo-Yo Rodriguez|Elena "Yo-Yo" Rodriguez]].{{cite episode|title=[[Bouncing Back]]|series=Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.|credits=Underwood, Ron (director); Monica Owusu-Breen (writer)|network=ABC|airdate=March 8, 2016|season=3|number=11}} Mack later goes on to become the director of S.H.I.E.L.D due to the ill health and subsequent death of [[Phil Coulson]].{{cite episode|title=[[Missing Pieces (Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.)|Missing Pieces]]|series=Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.|credits=[[Clark Gregg]] (director); Jed Whedon & Maurissa Tancharoen (writer)|network=ABC|airdate=May 10, 2019|season=6|number=1}} In the final episode, "What We're Fighting For", Mack continues to lead S.H.I.E.L.D.{{cite episode|title=[[Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. series finale|What We're Fighting For]]|series=Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.|credits=Kevin Tancharoen (director); Jed Whedon (writer)|network=ABC|airdate=August 12, 2020|season=7|number=13}} Simmons reprises his role in a six part [[web series]] titled ''[[Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.: Slingshot]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/tv/trailers/792743-agents-of-shield-lmd-and-a-slingshot-digital-series-are-coming#/slide/1|title=Agents of SHIELD: LMD and a Slingshot Digital Series are Coming|author=CS|website=[[ComingSoon.net]]|date=December 6, 2016|access-date=December 7, 2016}} ==References== {{reflist|30em}} ==External links== * [http://marvel.wikia.com/wiki/Alphonso_Mackenzie_(Earth-616) Al MacKenzie] at Marvel Wiki {{S.H.I.E.L.D.}} {{DEFAULTSORT:MacKenzie, Al}} [[Category:Characters created by Bob Harras]] [[Category:Characters created by Paul Neary]] [[Category:Comics characters introduced in 1988]] [[Category:Fictional Central Intelligence Agency personnel]] [[Category:Fictional characters from Texas]] [[Category:Fictional spymasters]] [[Category:Male characters in comics]] [[Category:Male characters in television]] [[Category:Marvel Comics male superheroes]] [[Category:Marvel Comics martial artists]] [[Category:Marvel Comics television characters]] [[Category:S.H.I.E.L.D. agents]]
